solution_line_template: Galileo pays ${rent_cost_per_month} x {months_per_year} = $<<{rent_cost_per_month}*{months_per_year}={rent_cost_per_year}>>{rent_cost_per_year} for renting a car every year.
He will pay ${new_car_cost_per_month} x {months_per_year} = $<<{new_car_cost_per_month}*{months_per_year}={new_car_cost_per_year}>>{new_car_cost_per_year} for the brand new car for a year.

Therefore the difference between a new car and a refurbished car is ${new_car_cost_per_year} - ${rent_cost_per_year} = $<<{new_car_cost_per_year}-{rent_cost_per_year}={cost_difference}>>{cost_difference}.
